name: benzyl_alcohol
source: Dreisbach R. R. Physical Properties of Chemical Compounds; Vol. I; American Chemical Society; Washington; 1955.
Reason: 1,1,1,2,2-pentafluoroethane has a melting point of -97.0 degrees Celsius. Fluorine substituents significantly increase the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each fluorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 15 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (15 degrees Celsius x 5 fluorines) = 75 degrees Celsius.
